title: Finger Ring with Busts of Deities
period: Late Ptolemaic Period to early Roman Period
description:
Gold finger ring with shank in form of a thick gold wire bent to form two and one half coils. Ends terminate in busts of Serapis (?) and Isis pointing in opposite directions. Details incised. 
Condition: Perfect.
dimensions: Diameter 15/16 x Length 1 1/4 in. (2.4 x 3.2 cm)
credit_line: Gift of Evangeline Wilbour Blashfield, Theodora Wilbour, and Victor Wilbour honoring the wishes of their mother, Charlotte Beebe Wilbour, as a memorial to their father, Charles Edwin Wilbour

If you have any information regarding this work and rights to it, please contact copyright@brooklynmuseum.org.

completeness.name: Good
completeness.description: Most data is approved, but records have not been fully vetted. Many objects have quality photos and descriptions.

collections.name: Egyptian, Classical, Ancient Near Eastern Art

exhibitions.title: Cleopatra's Egypt: Age of the Ptolemies
